channel.title: 2026-02 on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in 2026-02 on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally available: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in a third Availability Zone in New Zealan North
item.description:
Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in a third Availability Zone in the New Zealand North region.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: DCesv6, DCedsv6, ECesv6, and ECedsv6 confidential VMs
item.description:
Azure announced general availability of the DCesv6, DCedsv6, ECesv6, and ECedsv6 confidential VM series based on 5th Gen Intel Xeon processors with Intel Trust Domain Extensions (TDX).

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: Retirement: Managed NGINX Ingress with Application Routing Add-on Retiring November 2026
item.description:
Microsoft will retire the Managed NGINX Ingress used by the AKS Application Routing add-on in November 2026 due to the upstream Ingress-NGINX project deprecating and ending updates after March 2026. Microsoft will provide only critical security patches until 30 Nov 2026, after which the controller is unsupported.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Copilot usage metrics now includes enterprise-level GitHub Copilot CLI activity
item.description:
GitHub Copilot enterprise usage metrics now include GitHub Copilot CLI telemetry, expanding what’s counted in enterprise-level reporting.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Red Hat OpenShift is now available in Malaysia West, New Zealand North, and Mexico Central
item.description:
Azure Red Hat OpenShift (ARO) is now generally available in three additional Azure regions: Malaysia West, New Zealand North, and Mexico Central.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Copilot metrics is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics are now generally available, providing a centralized view of team adoption and usage.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: k8s: Before You Migrate: Five Surprising Ingress-NGINX Behaviors You Need to Know
item.description:
Kubernetes will retire the community Ingress-NGINX controller in March 2026; this post lists five non-obvious routing/rewriting/redirect behaviors that can cause outages when translating to Gateway API unless explicitly replicated.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: github: GitHub Actions now supports uploading and downloading non-zipped artifacts
item.description:
GitHub Actions artifacts can now be uploaded and downloaded without automatic ZIP compression in workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics report URLs update
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics API download URLs are now served from a new endpoint; report data, API contract, and response schema are unchanged.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise AI Controls & agent control plane now generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced general availability of Enterprise AI Controls and the agent control plane for GitHub Enterprise administrators.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Restrict usage of user delegation SAS to an Entra ID identity
item.description:
Azure Storage adds a preview feature to restrict (bind) user delegation SAS usage to a specific Microsoft Entra ID identity, strengthening authentication by tying SAS access to the user.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Vector Data in .NET – Building Blocks for AI Part 2
item.description:
Microsoft describes Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData as a .NET library that standardizes access to vector databases for semantic search scenarios.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Claude and Codex now available for Copilot Business & Pro users
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Business and Copilot Pro customers can now use Anthropic Claude and OpenAI Codex as coding agents. Copilot Enterprise and Pro+ customers got access earlier in February 2026.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Threat modeling AI applications
item.description:
Microsoft Security Blog post highlights AI threat modeling as a way to identify misuse, emergent risks, and failure modes in probabilistic and agentic AI systems.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: macos-26 is now generally available for GitHub-hosted runners
item.description:
GitHub Actions’ macOS 26 runner image is now generally available for GitHub-hosted runners, moving out of public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Content Exclusion REST API in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot adds a new Content Exclusion REST API (JSON) in public preview for organization and enterprise admins to manage Copilot content exclusion rules programmatically.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Mobile: Track coding agent progress in real time with Live Notifications
item.description:
GitHub Mobile now supports Live Coding Agent Notifications to monitor Copilot coding agent activity and supported third-party agent sessions in real time from the mobile app.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved search on the issues dashboard
item.description:
GitHub is rolling out semantic (natural-language) search in public preview on the Issues dashboard over the coming week.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Secure ingestion and pod placement for Azure Monitor pipeline
item.description:
Azure Monitor pipeline adds public-preview support for secure ingestion from external endpoints using TLS/mTLS and Bring Your Own Certificates (BYOC), plus new controls for pod placement.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Org-level metrics API now includes pull request throughput metric parity
item.description:
GitHub expanded the organization-level Copilot Usage Metrics API to add pull request activity metrics, bringing the org-level endpoints closer to other metrics parity.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Building Long-Distance Next Edit Suggestions
item.description:
VS Code describes extending GitHub Copilot Next Edit Suggestions so they can propose edits across an entire file rather than only nearby locations.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Generate pull request titles with Copilot on the web
item.description:
GitHub Copilot can now generate pull request titles directly on github.com when creating or editing a PR.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.3-Codex is now available in github.com, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio
item.description:
GPT-5.3-Codex is generally available for GitHub Copilot paid tiers and can be used via Copilot Chat across github.com, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved web search in Copilot on github.com
item.description:
Copilot Chat on github.com now supports model-native web search for certain models, allowing those models to use their built-in web browsing capability during chats.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure SQL updates for late-February 2026
item.description:
Late-February 2026 Azure SQL updates add a database object search feature to the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for late-February 2026
item.description:
Late-February 2026 preview updates for Azure SQL add in-dialog database management actions and introduce flat-file import support in the MSSQL extension.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Geo‑redundant backups for Premium SSD v2 in Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL now supports configuring geo-redundant automated backups when using Premium SSD v2 disks (public preview). This adds a disaster-recovery option by storing backups in a geo-redundant manner.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot CLI is now generally available for all paid GitHub Copilot subscribers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.20 release candidate is available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Server 3.20 release candidate is available. The changelog post indicates improvements in deployment efficiency, monitoring, code security, and policy management, but provides no concrete details in the provided excerpt.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: The Dongle Died at Midnight – WinForms Agent Saved my German Mom’s Business Trip
item.description:
A .NET Blog post describing how the author used a WinForms agent/AI-assisted development workflow to quickly build a replacement time-study app after a hardware dongle failed during a business trip.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: CodeQL adds Go 1.26 and Kotlin 2.3.10 support and improves query accuracy
item.description:
CodeQL 2.24.2 adds support for Go 1.26 and Kotlin 2.3.10, and includes query accuracy improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot can group updates by dependency name across multiple directories
item.description:
Dependabot can now group update PRs by dependency name across multiple directories in a repository.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Code Quality: Organization-level dashboard in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Code Quality added an organization-level dashboard in public preview to view code health across repositories with Code Quality enabled.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Repository dashboard is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub’s repository dashboard has moved from public preview to general availability. It lets users find, filter, and save custom views of repositories they can access.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Developer-targeting campaign using malicious Next.js repositories
item.description:
Microsoft reports a developer-targeting campaign that used malicious Next.js repositories to achieve covert remote code execution and stage command-and-control via normal build workflows.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: security: Scaling security operations with Microsoft Defender autonomous defense and expert-led services
item.description:
Guide-style post arguing that manual SOC processes and legacy tools can’t keep up with AI-enabled attacks, and positioning Microsoft Defender’s autonomous capabilities plus expert-led services as the proposed approach.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Enterprise-defined custom organization roles are generally available
item.description:
GitHub now generally makes available enterprise-defined custom organization roles to help enterprises standardize role-based access across multiple organizations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: Retirement: Windows Server Annual Channel (preview)
item.description:
Windows Server Annual Channel (Preview) on AKS will retire on May 15, 2026. Users should migrate to Windows Server Long Term Servicing Channel (LTSC) before that date.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: IP allow list coverage extended to EMU namespaces in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud now supports extending GitHub’s native IP allow list to user namespaces for Enterprise Managed Users (EMUs), available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise team support in organization APIs
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise organization owners can now discover and manage both enterprise teams and organization teams via existing organization team API endpoints.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: WAF Insights for Application Gateway
item.description:
Azure Application Gateway WAF Insights is now in public preview, adding an interactive view of WAF logs and metrics. It is intended to help investigate blocked requests and analyze attack patterns.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Organization-level Copilot usage metrics dashboard available in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has added an organization-level GitHub Copilot usage metrics dashboard in public preview, expanding access beyond enterprise-only dashboards.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk is now available in Brazil Southeast, and in a third Availability Zone in Malaysia West and Indonesia Central
item.description:
Azure Premium SSD v2 disks are now generally available in Brazil Southeast and expanded to a third Availability Zone in Malaysia West and Indonesia Central.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: ai: Microsoft Agent Framework Reaches Release Candidate
item.description:
Microsoft Agent Framework has reached Release Candidate for both .NET and Python. Microsoft states the v1.0 API surface is stable and intended v1.0 features are complete on the path to General Availability.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: github: Workflow dispatch API now returns run IDs
item.description:
GitHub’s Actions workflow dispatch API can now optionally return response metadata, including workflow run IDs, to help correlate a dispatch request with the resulting run.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot support in Zed generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot support in the Zed editor is now generally available via an official partnership. Copilot subscriptions (Pro, Pro+, Business, Enterprise) can authenticate and be used directly in Zed.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Changes to test merge commit generation for pull requests
item.description:
GitHub changed how often it generates test merge commits for open pull requests to reduce mergeability-check delays and improve reliability.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent model picker for Copilot Business and Enterprise
item.description:
GitHub announced a model picker for Copilot coding agent for Copilot Business and Enterprise users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Selected Anthropic and OpenAI models are now deprecated
item.description:
GitHub deprecated a set of Anthropic and OpenAI models across all GitHub Copilot experiences effective February 17, 2026.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Projects: Import items based on a query and hierarchy view improvements
item.description:
GitHub Projects now lets you populate a new project by importing items returned from a search query, not only by importing from a repository. The hierarchy view also received usability improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Access all pull request comments without leaving the new Files changed page
item.description:
GitHub’s new pull request “Files changed” page now lets reviewers access all pull request comments without switching to the “Conversation” tab.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3.1 Pro is now in public preview in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out public preview access to Google’s Gemini 3.1 Pro model.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: New e-book: Establishing a proactive defense with Microsoft Security Exposure Management
item.description:
Microsoft published a new e-book positioned as a maturity-based guide for adopting Microsoft Security Exposure Management. It focuses on moving from fragmented, reactive security practices to a unified exposure management approach intended to support proactive defense.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: security: Running OpenClaw safely: identity, isolation, and runtime risk
item.description:
Microsoft Security Blog outlines risks of self-hosted agent runtimes (like OpenClaw) that execute untrusted input while holding long-lived credentials, creating compounded supply-chain exposure. It emphasizes governance plus identity controls and runtime isolation to reduce credential and execution risk in enterprise deployments.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Pull request throughput and time to merge available in Copilot usage metrics API
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics APIs now include pull request outcomes metrics, enabling org-level reporting on PR throughput and time to merge.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: ai: What’s new in Microsoft Foundry | Dec 2025 & Jan 2026
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry’s Dec 2025–Jan 2026 updates add several new foundation models, expand audio and fine-tuning capabilities, and introduce SDK changes including an azure-ai-projects v2 beta consolidation.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: github: Use Copilot coding agent with Windows projects
item.description:
Copilot coding agent can now be used with Windows projects, running tasks asynchronously in a GitHub Actions-powered development environment.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent supports code referencing
item.description:
Copilot coding agent now supports Copilot code referencing for generated code that matches code in public GitHub repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning improvements to extended metadata checks
item.description:
GitHub Secret Scanning now supports configuring extended metadata checks via security configurations, making it easier to enable these checks across many repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.6 is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Claude Opus 4.6 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot for Enterprise, Business, Pro, and Pro+ plans. It can be used in Copilot Chat on github.com and in supported IDEs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Desktop 3.5.5 adds Git hooks support
item.description:
GitHub Desktop 3.5.5 adds support for Git hooks to address prior compatibility issues, especially with version managers and environment-dependent scripts.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: npm bulk trusted publishing config and script security now generally available
item.description:
npm CLI v11.10.0+ adds bulk management for OIDC trusted publishing configurations and makes a script security feature generally available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Cluster mode for the agentic CLI for AKS
item.description:
AKS agentic CLI adds a public preview “cluster mode” to run diagnostic agents with reduced inherited user permissions and avoid per-user deployments.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Unified tooling in the AKS MCP server
item.description:
AKS MCP Server adds unified tooling in public preview to reduce tool/context overhead when managing AKS MCP servers. Two new tools are introduced: call_az and call_kubectl.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.6 is now available on Azure Databricks
item.description:
Azure Databricks AI Model Serving now supports Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.6.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Functions .NET 10 support
item.description:
Azure Functions now generally supports .NET 10 for production workloads, allowing function apps to run on the latest .NET runtime.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Quota and deployment troubleshooting tools for Azure Functions Flex Consumption
item.description:
Azure Functions Flex Consumption now generally includes platform-integrated tools to troubleshoot quota availability and deployment behavior.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Node auto-provisioning support in Azure government and private cloud
item.description:
AKS node auto-provisioning is now generally available in Azure Government and Azure private cloud environments.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Node auto-provisioning enabled clusters in AKS now support LocalDNS
item.description:
AKS clusters using node auto-provisioning can now enable LocalDNS, removing a previous limitation where LocalDNS couldn’t be used with that cluster type.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Encryption at host & disk encryption sets support in node auto-provisioning
item.description:
AKS node auto-provisioning now supports Encryption at Host and disk encryption sets, enabling use in clusters with stricter encryption requirements.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: API access to billing usage reports in public preview
item.description:
GitHub is introducing a new REST API (public preview) that lets enterprise administrators request and download billing usage reports as CSV files.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: aks: Release 2026-02-08
item.description:
AKS release 2026-02-08 adds new Kubernetes patch versions, expands regional availability for API Server VNET Integration, and introduces several security/behavioral changes plus multiple component/image updates.

  • Source: Release notes from AKS

item.title: github: Enterprise-wide credential management tools for incident response
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud adds enterprise-wide credential management actions for enterprise owners to use during high-impact security incident response.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Sonnet 4.6 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out support for Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.6, now generally available. GitHub notes early testing shows strong performance on agentic coding, especially search.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: MCP Registry and more improvements in Copilot in Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub shipped updates to Copilot in Eclipse aimed at improving context handling, workflow smoothness, and customization.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] General Availability: Instant access support for incremental snapshots of Azure Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disk
item.description:
Azure Disk Storage now generally supports instant access for incremental snapshots of Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks, enabling immediate restores to new disks after snapshot creation.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Delegate tasks to Copilot coding agent from Visual Studio
item.description:
Visual Studio can now delegate coding tasks to GitHub Copilot coding agent, which runs asynchronously in the cloud and produces a draft pull request.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Unify now or pay later: New research exposes the operational cost of a fragmented SOC
item.description:
Microsoft and Omdia report that fragmented security tooling and workflows are increasing SOC operational strain and contributing to overload.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Assign issues to Copilot coding agent from Raycast
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent can now be assigned issues directly from Raycast, enabling you to delegate tasks to the agent and later review its work.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Required reviewer rule is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub’s “required reviewer” rule for repository rulesets is now generally available. It lets admins require approvals from specific reviewers for changes targeting defined branches and paths across an org/enterprise.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom properties and rule insights improvements
item.description:
GitHub shipped updates to organization/enterprise policy controls: custom properties now allow requiring an explicit value, and rule insights provide improved visibility into rule activity.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: devops+ai: 🔥AWS AgentCore Agentic Slack Bot - AgentCore MCP Gateway🔥
item.description:
Post claims an AWS AgentCore-based agentic Slack bot using an AgentCore MCP Gateway to centralize MCP tools and authentication.

  • Source: Let’s do DevOps

item.title: github: New features and improvements in GitHub Copilot in JetBrains IDEs
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for JetBrains IDEs received an update adding preview support for Agent Skills plus UX improvements in inline chat and settings.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Updated GitHub status page experience
item.description:
GitHub updated its status page to make incident details easier to find and more useful during active incidents. The status site now includes a 90-day historical view of availability.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: ai: DPO Fine-Tuning Using Microsoft Foundry SDK
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry published a guide on using the Foundry SDK to fine-tune LLMs with Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) to better align outputs with human preferences.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: github: Show profile names (first and last name) alongside user handles
item.description:
GitHub now lets enterprise and organization admins choose whether to display users’ profile names (first and last) alongside their handles across the enterprise UI.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New repository settings for configuring pull request access
item.description:
GitHub added two new repository settings to control how a repo accepts contributions via pull requests, including an option to disable pull requests entirely.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Network configuration changes for Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub announced upcoming network configuration changes for Copilot coding agent, which runs background tasks in its own GitHub Actions-powered environment.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Agentic Workflows are now in technical preview
item.description:
GitHub introduced Agentic Workflows in technical preview, enabling AI agents to run repository automation tasks inside GitHub Actions. Workflows can be authored in Markdown rather than YAML, delegating task planning/execution to the agent.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: AKS support for Kubernetes version 1.34
item.description:
AKS now generally supports Kubernetes v1.34. The upstream v1.34 release includes 58 enhancements across feature maturity levels.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: Copilot Studio agent security: Top 10 risks you can detect and prevent
item.description:
Microsoft outlines 10 common security risks in Copilot Studio agents and pairs each with suggested detection and mitigation approaches using Microsoft Defender. The focus is on preventing exposure from configuration, access, and orchestration weaknesses.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: security: Your complete guide to Microsoft experiences at RSAC™ 2026 Conference
item.description:
Microsoft announced its presence at the RSAC 2026 Conference and positioned its show-floor content around “Frontier Firms,” described as human-led and agent-operated organizations.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: k8s: Spotlight on SIG Architecture: API Governance
item.description:
Interview with Jordan Liggitt describing SIG Architecture’s API Governance subproject: it defines and enforces conventions across Kubernetes API surfaces to balance stability/compatibility with ongoing evolution.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for mid-February 2026
item.description:
Mid-February 2026 Azure SQL preview adds new Visual Studio Code publishing support for SQL Projects and introduces a Connections Migration dialog to import existing workflows.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GitHub Mobile: Model picker for Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub Mobile now lets Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers select an AI model when starting a Copilot coding agent session.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET Brings AI-powered Unit Tests to Visual Studio 2026
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET is generally available in Visual Studio 18.3, adding an AI-assisted workflow to generate and iterate on unit tests directly in the IDE.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: ai: Beyond the Prompt – Why and How to Fine-tune Your Own Models
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry argues that enterprise LLM deployments often need behavior-level alignment (consistency, reliability, policy compliance) that prompt engineering and RAG cannot provide, positioning fine-tuning as the mechanism to change model behavior.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: security: The strategic SIEM buyer’s guide: Choosing an AI-ready platform for the agentic era
item.description:
Microsoft Security Blog published a post promoting a new buyer’s guide for selecting a unified, AI-ready SIEM platform aimed at supporting “agentic” AI-era security operations.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: dotnet: .NET 11 Preview 1 is now available!
item.description:
.NET 11 Preview 1 is available as the first preview release of .NET 11.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Front Door Premium now supports Azure Private Link origins in UAE North
item.description:
Azure Front Door Premium (public preview) now supports configuring Azure Private Link-enabled origins in the UAE North region.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: .NET and .NET Framework February 2026 servicing releases updates
item.description:
Recap post for February 2026 servicing updates across .NET and .NET Framework.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Databricks Supervisor Agent
item.description:
Azure Databricks Supervisor Agent is now generally available as part of the Azure Databricks Agent Bricks Platform.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: 80% of Fortune 500 use active AI Agents: Observability, governance, and security shape the new frontier
item.description:
Microsoft Security Blog post promoting its Cyber Pulse report, focused on cybersecurity risks related to active AI agents and the need for observability, governance, and security.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: security: Manipulating AI memory for profit: The rise of AI Recommendation Poisoning
item.description:
Microsoft security researchers describe a growing pattern of “AI Recommendation Poisoning,” where attackers poison an AI system’s memory to manipulate future recommendations for promotional gain.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Track additional Dependabot configuration changes in audit logs
item.description:
GitHub added two new audit log event types to track additional Dependabot settings changes at the organization and enterprise levels.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Application Gateway for Containers - AKS managed add-on
item.description:
Azure announced a public preview AKS managed add-on for Application Gateway for Containers that automates deployment and lifecycle management of the gateway and its ALB Controller.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GPT-5.3-Codex is now generally available for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out general availability of OpenAI’s GPT-5.3-Codex model.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: A one-prompt attack that breaks LLM safety alignment
item.description:
The provided excerpt is only a short teaser and does not include the article’s technical details, findings, or mitigations.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: GitHub Apps can now utilize public preview Enterprise Teams APIs via fine-grained permissions
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise admins can now authorize GitHub Apps (using fine-grained enterprise teams permissions) to access Enterprise Teams API endpoints in public preview. Previously, these endpoints required a classic personal access token.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Fast mode for Claude Opus 4.6 is now in preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out a research/public preview of Claude Opus 4.6 “Fast mode.” The mode increases output token generation speed by up to 2.5×.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Analysis of active exploitation of SolarWinds Web Help Desk
item.description:
Microsoft reports active exploitation of SolarWinds Web Help Desk using CVE-2025-40551 and CVE-2025-40536 that can lead to domain compromise, and provides guidance to patch, hunt, and mitigate.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.24.1 improves Maven private registry support and improves query accuracy
item.description:
CodeQL 2.24.1 was released with improved support for Maven private registries and enhancements to query accuracy.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Vaulted Backups for Azure Disk
item.description:
Azure Disk Backup is adding a private preview feature called Vaulted Backups for Azure Disk. It extends current disk protection beyond in-subscription operational snapshots toward storing backups in a vault tier.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Monitor pipeline data transformations
item.description:
Azure Monitor pipeline data transformations is now in public preview, allowing telemetry to be transformed before ingestion into Azure Monitor.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: ai: Building an AI Skills Executor in .NET: Bringing Anthropic’s Agent Pattern to the Microsoft Ecosystem
item.description:
Guest post outlining how to implement an “AI Skills Executor” in .NET using Azure OpenAI and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) C# SDK to replicate Anthropic-style agent patterns.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: New planned datacenter region in Thailand (Thailand South)
item.description:
Microsoft intends to establish a new Azure datacenter region in Thailand called Thailand South, currently in private preview.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] ​Generally Available: Claude Opus 4.6 now available on Azure Databricks
item.description:
Azure Databricks added support for Anthropic Claude Opus 4.6 via Mosaic AI Model Serving.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: AMD v6 confidential VMs in new regions for January 2026
item.description:
Azure DCa/ECa v6 AMD-based confidential VMs are now generally available in 11 additional regions.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Improved pull request Files changed – February 5 updates
item.description:
GitHub updated the new pull request “Files changed” experience with CODEOWNERS validation and performance improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure virtual network routing appliance
item.description:
Azure introduced a public preview of the Azure Virtual Network routing appliance for providing private connectivity across virtual networks using a dedicated routing appliance.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: New Clickfix variant ‘CrashFix’ deploying Python Remote Access Trojan
item.description:
Microsoft reports a new ClickFix variant, “CrashFix,” that intentionally crashes browsers to trick users into running commands that install a Python-based remote access trojan (RAT). The campaign abuses built-in utilities (finger.exe) and a portable Python runtime to reduce detection and maintain persistence on targeted systems.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Claude Opus 4.6, Available on Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry now offers Claude Opus 4.6 in public preview, making Anthropic’s Opus 4.6 model available on Azure for enterprise use.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: .NET Framework 3.5 Moves to Standalone Deployment in new versions of Windows
item.description:
.NET Framework 3.5 servicing on newer Windows versions changes to a standalone deployment model rather than being serviced as part of the OS image.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Pinned comments on GitHub Issues
item.description:
GitHub Issues now supports pinning a comment on an issue to keep key information visible and reduce noise while scanning discussions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.6 is now generally available for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out support for Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.6 model and marking it as generally available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: The security implementation gap: Why Microsoft is supporting Operation Winter SHIELD
item.description:
Microsoft explains that many incidents stem from inconsistent implementation of known security controls and describes its support for Operation Winter SHIELD to help organizations close this “implementation gap.”

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: GitHub Actions: Self-hosted runner minimum version enforcement extended
item.description:
GitHub extended the deadline for configuration-time minimum version enforcement for self-hosted Actions runners by one week.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Actions: Early February 2026 updates
item.description:
GitHub Actions’ early February 2026 update adds custom runner autoscaling, broadens security controls to all users, and provides early access to new Windows and macOS runner images.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Your Home for Multi-Agent Development
item.description:
VS Code adds a unified interface to manage multiple coding agents (local, background, and cloud) from one place. It supports using third-party agents like Claude and Codex alongside Copilot and emphasizes interoperability via MCP and Agent Skills.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files Elastic zone-redundant service level
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files Elastic zone-redundant storage (Elastic ZRS) is now in public preview. It aims to provide continuous access and zero data loss even if an entire Azure Availability Zone becomes unavailable.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Showing tool calls and other improvements to Copilot chat on the web
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com now shows tool call details in chat responses and includes additional performance and UX improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code v1.109 – January Release
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for VS Code v1.109 (January 2026) adds agent-driven workflows, improves agent session management, and introduces agent support for Anthropic Claude models.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — January update
item.description:
January 2026 updates to GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio add colorized code completions, the ability to partially accept a completion, and general productivity improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Detecting backdoored language models at scale
item.description:
Microsoft published research on detecting backdoors in open-weight language models and described a scanner intended to identify backdoored models at scale.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: vscode: January 2026 Insiders (version 1.109)
item.description:
This brief entry announces the Visual Studio Code January 2026 Release (Insiders) version 1.109 and points readers to the full article for details on what’s new in this release.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: azure: [In development] Public Preview: X-Forwarded-For (XFF) grouping for rate limiting on Application Gateway WAF v2
item.description:
Azure Application Gateway WAF v2 now offers Public Preview support for additional rate‑limiting GroupBy options that use the X‑Forwarded‑For (XFF) HTTP header, enabling better client identification when the gateway is behind proxies or CDNs.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Kubernetes Fleet Manager namespace-scoped resource placement
item.description:
Azure Kubernetes Fleet Manager now offers namespace‑scoped resource placement in public preview, providing fine‑grained control to select and propagate individual namespace resources across multiple clusters.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Container Storage v2.1.0 now with Elastic SAN integration and on demand installation
item.description:
Azure Container Storage v2.1.0 is generally available, adding native Elastic SAN support and a lightweight on‑demand installation model to simplify deployment and operations for Kubernetes workloads on Azure.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Dependabot now supports OIDC authentication
item.description:
GitHub Dependabot can now authenticate to private registries using OpenID Connect (OIDC), removing the need to store long-lived registry credentials as repository secrets for Dependabot update jobs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Microsoft SDL: Evolving security practices for an AI-powered world
item.description:
Microsoft describes an updated Secure Development Lifecycle (SDL) approach aimed at securing AI systems, combining internal policy, security research, and enablement activities.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: The Dependabot Proxy is now open source with an MIT license
item.description:
GitHub has open-sourced the Dependabot Proxy and released it under the permissive MIT license, allowing developers to review the implementation (including how authentication is handled for different package ecosystems), reuse it, and contribute.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: devops+ai: 🔥AWS AgentCore Agentic Slack Bot - Full Architecture and Code🔥
item.description:
A short post announcing a full-architecture and code walkthrough for an AWS AgentCore agentic Slack bot, with an enthusiastic call to deploy it.

  • Source: Let’s do DevOps

item.title: k8s: Introducing Node Readiness Controller
item.description:
The Node Readiness Controller is a new Kubernetes project that provides a declarative system (NodeReadinessRule) to manage node taints based on custom node conditions. It extends readiness guardrails during node bootstrapping and runtime by automating taint application/removal so workloads land only on nodes that meet infrastructure-specific requirements.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: security: Infostealers without borders: macOS, Python stealers, and platform abuse
item.description:
Microsoft describes recent infostealer activity targeting macOS, highlighting Python-based stealers and distribution techniques that abuse trusted platforms and common utilities.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Serverless workspaces in Azure Databricks
item.description:
Azure Databricks serverless workspaces are now generally available: a fully managed workspace option that includes preconfigured serverless compute and default storage to provide an enterprise-ready, SaaS-like experience with no infrastructure to manage.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: Retirement: Azure Front Door and Azure CDN profiles will end support for DHE cipher suites on April 1, 2026
item.description:
Microsoft will end support on April 1, 2026 for weak DHE TLS cipher suites used by Azure Front Door (Standard, Premium, Classic) and Azure CDN from Microsoft (Classic) to improve security.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Default Ruleset 2.2 in WAF for Azure Application Gateway
item.description:
Microsoft announced the general availability of Default Rule Set (DRS) 2.2 for Web Application Firewall (WAF) on Azure Application Gateway. The Azure-managed rule set provides active protection against common web vulnerabilities and exploits and includes Microsoft Threat Intelligence.

  • Source: Azure Updates
